docs.title: Agentium Python SDK
docs.text: Python SDK for Agentium Network - DID and Verifiable Credentials.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Google Sign-In Integration - Connect identities with a single function call
  • Async-first Design - Built with httpx for modern async Python
  • Native Rust Core - Cryptographic operations powered by Rust via PyO3
  • Type Safety - Full type hints and PEP 561 compatible

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
import agentium_sdk

# Async (recommended)
wallet_address, did = await agentium_sdk.connect_google(google_id_token)

# Sync wrapper available
wallet_address, did = agentium_sdk.connect_google_sync(google_id_token)

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install agentium-sdk

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Getting Started - Installation and first steps
  • API Reference - Complete API documentation

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install agentium-sdk

docs.title: Connect with Google Sign-In
docs.text:
The simplest way to use Agentium is through the connect_google function:

import agentium_sdk

async def handle_google_login(google_id_token: str):
    """Handle Google Sign-In and get wallet address + DID."""
    wallet_address, did = await agentium_sdk.connect_google(google_id_token)

    print(f"Wallet: {wallet_address}")  # 0x...
    print(f"DID: {did}")                # did:pkh:eip155:1:0x...

    return wallet_address, did

For synchronous code:

wallet_address, did = agentium_sdk.connect_google_sync(google_id_token)

docs.title: Using AgentiumClient
docs.text:
For more control, use the AgentiumClient directly:

from agentium_sdk import AgentiumClient

async with AgentiumClient() as client:
    # Connect identity
    response = await client.connect_google_identity(google_id_token)

    # Fetch membership credential
    credential = await client.fetch_membership_credential(response.access_token)

    # Verify credential
    result = await client.verify_credential(credential)
    if result.valid:
        print(result.claims)  # dict with JWT claims

docs.title: Custom Endpoint
docs.text:
async with AgentiumClient(base_url="https://custom.api.endpoint") as client:
    # ... use client

docs.title: Telemetry
docs.text:
Enable structured tracing for debugging:

from agentium_sdk import init_tracing

def handle_event(event: dict):
    print(f"[{event['level']}] {event['name']}: {event['fields']}")

# Initialize once at startup
init_tracing(handle_event, "debug")

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
from agentium_sdk import AgentiumClient, AgentiumApiError

async with AgentiumClient() as client:
    try:
        response = await client.connect_google_identity(invalid_token)
    except AgentiumApiError as e:
        print(f"Error: {e.message}")
        print(f"Status: {e.status_code}")

docs.title: Next Steps

• API Reference - Complete API documentation
  • Client Methods - All AgentiumClient methods
  • Native Functions - Low-level cryptographic operations

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Agentium SDK is organized into several modules:

Module Description Client AgentiumClient for API interactions Types Response dataclasses Native Functions Rust-powered cryptographic operations Exceptions Error types

docs.title: agentium_sdk.connect_google async
docs.text:
connect_google(google_id_token: str, *, base_url: str = 'https://api.agentium.network') -> tuple[str, str]

Connect a Google identity and return wallet address and DID.

This is a convenience function that creates a client, connects the identity, and returns the wallet address and DID.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default google_id_token str

The JWT token obtained from Google Sign-In.

required base_url str

The Agentium API base URL.

'https://api.agentium.network'

Returns:

Type Description tuple[str, str]

Tuple of (wallet_address, did).

Raises:

Type Description AgentiumApiError

If the request fails.

Example

wallet_address, did = await agentium_sdk.connect_google(google_id_token) print(wallet_address) # 0x... print(did) # did:pkh:eip155:1:0x...

'https://api.agentium.network'

Returns:

If the request fails.

Example

wallet_address, did = agentium_sdk.connect_google_sync(google_id_token) print(wallet_address) # 0x... print(did) # did:pkh:eip155:1:0x...

docs.title: AgentiumClient
docs.text: The main client for interacting with the Agentium API.

docs.title: agentium_sdk.AgentiumClient
docs.text:
A client for interacting with the Agentium API.

This client provides methods for: - Connecting Google identities to create DIDs - Exchanging API keys for tokens (M2M authentication) - Refreshing access tokens - Fetching and verifying membership credentials

Example

async with AgentiumClient() as client: ... response = await client.connect_google_identity(google_id_token) ... print(response.did)

docs.title: __init__
docs.text:
__init__(base_url: str = DEFAULT_BASE_URL, timeout: float = 30.0) -> None

Create an AgentiumClient instance.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default base_url str

The base URL of the Agentium API. Defaults to https://api.agentium.network

DEFAULT_BASE_URL timeout float

Request timeout in seconds. Defaults to 30.0.

30.0

docs.title: connect_google_identity async
docs.text:
connect_google_identity(google_token: str) -> ConnectIdentityResponse

Connect a Google identity to an Agentium identity.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default google_token str

The JWT token obtained from Google Sign-In.

required

Returns:

Type Description ConnectIdentityResponse

ConnectIdentityResponse containing the user's DID and tokens.

Raises:

Type Description AgentiumApiError

If the request fails. - 400: Bad Request - malformed request or unsupported grant type. - 401: Unauthorized - invalid or expired JWT token. - 500: Internal Server Error.

Fetch a membership credential from the backend.

An auth token for authorization.

required

Raises:

Type Description AgentiumApiError

401 if token invalid/expired, 403 if user banned.

docs.title: fetch_issuer_did_document async
docs.text:
fetch_issuer_did_document() -> dict[str, Any]

Fetch the issuer's DID document from /.well-known/did.json.

The DID document contains the public key used to verify VCs.

Returns:

Type Description dict[str, Any]

The issuer's DID document as a dict.

Raises:

Type Description AgentiumApiError

If the request fails.

docs.title: verify_credential async
docs.text:
verify_credential(jwt: str) -> VerificationResult

Verify a JWT-VC against the issuer's public key.

Extracts the key ID from the JWT header, fetches the DID document, finds the matching public key, and verifies the signature.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default jwt str

The JWT-VC to verify.

required

Returns:

Type Description VerificationResult

VerificationResult with validity status, decoded claims, and error if invalid.

docs.title: Native Functions
docs.text: Low-level cryptographic operations powered by Rust.

docs.title: agentium_sdk.verify_jwt
docs.text:
verify_jwt(jwt: str, public_key_jwk: str) -> VerificationResult

Verify a JWT against a public key.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default jwt str

The JWT string to verify (compact format: header.payload.signature)

required public_key_jwk str

The public key as JWK JSON string

required

Returns:

Type Description VerificationResult

VerificationResult with validity status and decoded claims if valid

required

Extract the public key JWK from a DID document.

Parameters:

The DID document as JSON string

required kid str | None

Optional key ID to match (from JWT header). Can be full ID or just fragment.

None

Returns:

Type Description str

The public key as JWK JSON string

Raises:

Type Description ValueError

docs.title: agentium_sdk.init_tracing
docs.text:
init_tracing(callback: Any, filter: str | None = None) -> None

Initialize telemetry with a Python callback.

Sets up tracing to forward log events to a Python function. This can only be called once per process; subsequent calls are ignored.

Parameters:

Name Type Description Default callback Any

Python function to receive telemetry events. Each event has: kind, level, target, name, fields, ts_ms

required filter str | None

Optional filter string (e.g., "info", "debug", "agentium=trace"). Defaults to "info" if not provided.

None Example

def my_handler(event): ... print(f"[{event['level']}] {event['target']}: {event['fields']}") init_tracing(my_handler, "debug")
